SVPipeline.base_file_name.description: Base file name for the output files (to be used as the prefix)

SVPipeline.cloud_provider_override.description: Cloud provider to use for the workflow. Currently supported: aws, gcp default: gcp

useCase.structural_variant_pipeline_template-som: variantcalling.breakpointLowQuality = 120.0 variantcalling.breakendLowQuality = 120.0 variantcalling.writeFiltered = true variantcalling.requireReadPair = false variantcalling.requireSplitRead = false variantcalling.callUnassembledBreakends = true variantcalling.callUnassembledBreakpoints = true variantcalling.breakendMaxAssemblySupportBias = 100 variantcalling.breakpointMaxAssemblySupportBias = 100 variantcalling.includeSingleAssemblyFilter = false variantcalling.requiredReadAndAssemblyBreakpointOverlap = 5
useCase.structural_variant_pipeline_template-ger: variantcalling.breakpointLowQuality = 120.0 variantcalling.breakendLowQuality = 120.0 variantcalling.writeFiltered = true variantcalling.requireReadPair = false variantcalling.requireSplitRead = false variantcalling.callUnassembledBreakends = true variantcalling.callUnassembledBreakpoints = true variantcalling.breakendMaxAssemblySupportBias = 100 variantcalling.breakpointMaxAssemblySupportBias = 100 variantcalling.includeSingleAssemblyFilter = false variantcalling.requiredReadAndAssemblyBreakpointOverlap = 5

SVPipeline.create_md5_checksum_outputs.description: Create md5 checksum for requested output files

SVPipeline.exclude_filters.description: gripss paramter: Exclude filters from the output vcf, separated by ;

SVPipeline.giraffe_parameters.description: vg giraffe index files to improve haplotype interpretation using population graphs

SVPipeline.homopolymer_length.description: Realignment parameter: do realignment on homopolymeres longer than this value

SVPipeline.input_germline_crams.description: Input CRAM file for the germline or matched normal sample; optinal for supporting somatic calling tumor only, default []

SVPipeline.input_germline_crams_indexes.description: Input CRAM index for the germline or matched normal sample; optinal for supporting somatic calling tumor only

SVPipeline.input_tumor_crams.description: Input CRAM file for the tumor (in case of matched T/N calling)

SVPipeline.input_tumor_crams_indexes.description: Input CRAM index for the tumor (in case of matched T/N calling)

SVPipeline.is_somatic.description: run in somatic mode or in germline mode

SVPipeline.known_hotspot_file.description: gripss paramter: Known locations that are hot spot for SVs (see https://github.com/hartwigmedical/hmftools/tree/master/linx), filtered less stringently

SVPipeline.max_num_haps.description: Assembly parameter: Maximum number of haplotypes showing an evidence of SV to report

SVPipeline.max_reads_per_partition.description: Assembly parameter: Maximal number of reads that are stored in memory when analyzing an active region

SVPipeline.max_reads_per_working_area.description: Rematching parameter: Maximal number of reads that are stored in memory when rematching reads to haplotypes (similar to max_reads_per_partition in assembly)

SVPipeline.min_base.description: Assembly parameter: Minimum base quality for using in DeBruijn graph construction. Default value in template

SVPipeline.min_indel_sc_size_to_include.description: Assembly parameter: Minimum size of an indel and soft-clipping in the read to include the read in the assembly. ;-separated between samples

SVPipeline.min_mapq.description: Assembly parameter: Minimum mapping quality. Default value in template

SVPipeline.min_mismatch_count_to_include.description: Assembly parameter: Minimal number of counts to require to include the read in the assembly. ;-separated between samples

SVPipeline.min_normal_coverage.description: gripss paramter: Minimum coverage in the normal sample to determine somatic status. Default value:8

SVPipeline.num_shards.description: Relevant for scatter tasks, which are CreateAssembly and gridss.AnnotateVariants

SVPipeline.pon_sgl_file.description: gripss paramter: Panel of normals for single end breakend (partially resolved) calls. Note that the default value is in template

SVPipeline.pon_sv_file.description: gripss paramter: panel of normals for breakpoint (fully resolved) calls. Note that the default value is in template

SVPipeline.prefilter_query.description: Expression (in bcftools view format) to filter the variants before annotation

SVPipeline.realign_mapq.description: Realignment parameter: Below this value we skip realignment on the supplementary alignment

SVPipeline.references.description: Reference files: fasta, dict and fai, recommended value set in the template

SVPipeline.repeat_mask_file.description: gripss paramter: Repeat mask file. Note that the default value is in template

SVPipeline.run_giraffe.description: Whether to run Giraffe haplotype aware alignment or not

SVPipeline.run_ua.description: Whether to run UA realignment on the output of the assembly (helps resolving some deletions) or not

SVPipeline.symbolic_vcf_format.description: Whether to convert the output vcf to the region format or not, default True

SVPipeline.ua_references.description: UAReference files: ua_index, ref_alt, v_aware_alignment_flag and ua_extra_args, recommended value set in the template

SVPipeline.wgs_calling_interval_list.description: interval list defining the region to perform variant calling on, recommended value set in the template
